perduint, archaic form of perdant (as duint for dent), used often by Plautus, thrice by Terence, twice by Cicero. Plautus also employs perduim, perduis, perduit. In Terence occur duim, duit, duint, in Plautus duim, duis or duas, duit, duint. Cf. 519, 713, 976, 1005.
